abstract: Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.

declaration.code: func decode<Item, Coder>(type: Item.Type, decoder: Coder) -> Publishers.Decode<Self, Item, Coder> where Item : Decodable, Coder : TopLevelDecoder, Self.Output == Coder.Input

overview:
## Return Value

A publisher that decodes a given type using a specified decoder and publishes the result.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/decode(type:decoder:)] with a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/JSONDecoder] (or a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/PropertyListDecoder] for property lists) to decode data received from a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/URLSession/DataTaskPublisher] or other data source using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Decodable] protocol.

In this example, a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject] publishes a JSON string. The JSON decoder parses the string, converting its fields according to the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Decodable] protocol implemented by `Article`, and successfully populating a new `Article`. The [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Decode] publisher then publishes the `Article` to the downstream. If a decoding operation fails, which happens in the case of missing or malformed data in the source JSON string, the stream terminates and passes the error to the downstream subscriber.

# decode(type:decoder:)

**Instance Method**

Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.

## Declaration

```swift
func decode<Item, Coder>(type: Item.Type, decoder: Coder) -> Publishers.Decode<Self, Item, Coder> where Item : Decodable, Coder : TopLevelDecoder, Self.Output == Coder.Input
```

## Parameters

- **type**: The encoded data to decode into a struct that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Decodable] protocol.
- **decoder**: A decoder that implements the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/TopLevelDecoder] protocol.

## Return Value

A publisher that decodes a given type using a specified decoder and publishes the result.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/decode(type:decoder:)] with a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/JSONDecoder] (or a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/PropertyListDecoder] for property lists) to decode data received from a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/URLSession/DataTaskPublisher] or other data source using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Decodable] protocol.

In this example, a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject] publishes a JSON string. The JSON decoder parses the string, converting its fields according to the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Decodable] protocol implemented by `Article`, and successfully populating a new `Article`. The [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Decode] publisher then publishes the `Article` to the downstream. If a decoding operation fails, which happens in the case of missing or malformed data in the source JSON string, the stream terminates and passes the error to the downstream subscriber.

```swift
struct Article: Codable {
    let title: String
    let author: String
    let pubDate: Date
}

let dataProvider = PassthroughSubject<Data, Never>()
cancellable = dataProvider
    .decode(type: Article.self, decoder: JSONDecoder())
    .sink(receiveCompletion: { print ("Completion: \($0)")},
          receiveValue: { print ("value: \($0)") })

dataProvider.send(Data("{\"pubDate\":1574273638.575666, \"title\" : \"My First Article\", \"author\" : \"Gita Kumar\" }".utf8))

// Prints: ".sink() data received Article(title: "My First Article", author: "Gita Kumar", pubDate: 2050-11-20 18:13:58 +0000)"
```

## Encoding and decoding

- **encode(encoder:)**: Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.

items.description: Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.
items.name: encode(encoder:)
